If you’re looking to grab a new SSD for a PC, [PS5](https://www.engadget.com/gaming/playstation/best-ssd-for-ps5-130004175.html), [gaming handheld](https://www.engadget.com/gaming/best-handheld-gaming-system-140018863.html) or any other gadget, [Cyber Monday](https://www.engadget.com/deals/cyber-monday-deals-on-tech-for-2025-the-best-sales-from-apple-amazon-lego-dyson-disney-and-others-are-up-to-50-percent-off-170028712.html) is typically a good time to take the plunge. To help you separate the fake discounts from the stuff worth your time, we’ve picked through the many sales going on now and rounded up the best Cyber Monday SSD deals and other storage discounts we could find below. The highlights include a handful of discounts on well-reviewed [internal drives](https://www.engadget.com/computing/accessories/best-ssds-140014262.html), [portable SSDs](https://www.engadget.com/computing/accessories/best-portable-ssd-120043652.html) and [microSD cards](https://www.engadget.com/computing/accessories/best-microsd-card-130038282.html), but we'll update this post as we find more offers that are worth calling out.

## Best Cyber Monday microSD card deals

[**Samsung P9 Express microSD Express Card (512GB) for $75 at Amazon ($25 off MSRP)**](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0FT995SPF&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=499da910-4f76-49c5-a36f-e846bcb30f62&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=Samsung+P9+Express+microSD+Express+Card+%28512GB%29+for+%2475+at+Amazon+%28%2425+off+MSRP%29&custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2RwL0IwRlQ5OTVTUEY_dGFnPWdkZ3QwYy0yMCIsImNvbnRlbnRVdWlkIjoiNDk5ZGE5MTAtNGY3Ni00OWM1LWEzNmYtZTg0NmJjYjMwZjYyIiwib3JpZ2luYWxVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2RwL0IwRlQ5OTVTUEYiLCJkeW5hbWljQ2VudHJhbFRyYWNraW5nSWQiOnRydWUsInNpdGVJZCI6InVzLWVuZ2FkZ2V0IiwicGFnZUlkIjoiMXAtYXV0b2xpbmsiLCJmZWF0dXJlSWQiOiJ0ZXh0LWxpbmsifQ&signature=AQAAAbMLiwnNQ-FVrYVlHSeDknO78xytKhHdjVywe1QH-ieW&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fdp%2FB0FT995SPF): If you need even more room for your Switch 2, this is a new low for the 512GB version of Samsung’s newest microSD Express card. Full disclosure: Samsung [launched this card](https://www.engadget.com/gaming/nintendo/samsung-has-a-new-line-of-microsd-express-cards-for-the-switch-2-190933303.html) a couple of weeks ago, and we only just got it in for testing. But given the trend of similar Switch 2 performance we’ve seen with other Express cards thus far, and the fact that this is easily the cheapest 512GB model we can find in stock as of this writing, we figure it’s worth noting. Also at [Samsung](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=f85e63cd-e13c-4f9d-991c-9fbaadede3ac&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=499da910-4f76-49c5-a36f-e846bcb30f62&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Samsung+Electronics&linkText=Samsung&&signature=AQAAASbORsK9IE19LeXtl8Ta4ybOxsa9fDLrqM1VviIhzqUn&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.samsung.com%2Fus%2Fmemory-storage%2Fmemory-card%2Fp9-512gb-microsd-express-card-sku-mb-mk512t-am%2F) and [B&H](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=95276f3c-7b79-4c1e-803f-981cd9f7a968&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=499da910-4f76-49c5-a36f-e846bcb30f62&featureId=text-link&merchantName=B%26H+Photo&linkText=B%26H&&signature=AQAAAfYwl8iQw4umRd7tJdcIBZzSZqI1-4C3pCEKFVk5_x9Q&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bhphotovideo.com%2Fc%2Fproduct%2F1924976-REG%2Fsamsung_mb_mk512t_am_512gb_p9_microsd_express.html).

[**Lexar Play Pro (1TB) microSD Express card for $186 at Amazon ($34 off)**](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0DYB9TNB4&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=499da910-4f76-49c5-a36f-e846bcb30f62&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=Lexar+Play+Pro+%281TB%29+microSD+Express+card+for+%24186+at+Amazon+%28%2434+off%29&custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2RwL0IwRFlCOVROQjQ_dGFnPWdkZ3QwYy0yMCIsImNvbnRlbnRVdWlkIjoiNDk5ZGE5MTAtNGY3Ni00OWM1LWEzNmYtZTg0NmJjYjMwZjYyIiwib3JpZ2luYWxVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2RwL0IwRFlCOVROQjQiLCJkeW5hbWljQ2VudHJhbFRyYWNraW5nSWQiOnRydWUsInNpdGVJZCI6InVzLWVuZ2FkZ2V0IiwicGFnZUlkIjoiMXAtYXV0b2xpbmsiLCJmZWF0dXJlSWQiOiJ0ZXh0LWxpbmsifQ&signature=AQAAAZ6cC7fjPkSn6jq21wU_Bqsn0imGfeQPXXY0ZJ2xq7DM&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fdp%2FB0DYB9TNB4): If you want the most space possible for Nintendo's new console, the Play Pro is one of the few microSD Express cards available in a 1TB capacity. This is the second-best price we've seen for that card since July, so it's not an amazing deal, but it is the cheapest 1TB model we can find from a reliable brand right now.

[**SanDisk microSD Express Card (256GB) for $60 at Amazon ($8 off)**](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0DFQGVLYF&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=499da910-4f76-49c5-a36f-e846bcb30f62&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=SanDisk+microSD+Express+Card+%28256GB%29+for+%2460+at+Amazon+%28%248+off%29&&signature=AQAAARSxsEJxiVp9LmUvswnVeWdzklCuu-Fy13hNiv-1tWT5&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2FSanDisk-256GB-microSD-Express-SDSQXFN-256G-GN4NN%2Fdp%2FB0DFQGVLYF): Like the offers above, this discount matches the best price we’ve seen for SanDisk’s 256GB microSD Express card. There isn’t much point in grabbing it as long as cheaper options are in stock, though this is technically the fastest all-around model we’ve tested when it comes to transferring games to and from the Switch 2’s built-in storage. (Within games, however, the difference is still minimal.) We’ll note it here just in case the other Express models completely sell out. Also at [B&H](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=95276f3c-7b79-4c1e-803f-981cd9f7a968&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=499da910-4f76-49c5-a36f-e846bcb30f62&featureId=text-link&merchantName=B%26H+Photo&linkText=B%26H&&signature=AQAAAYzYCCYr5HIgz5Y6DzMae5gs7NuF-CMcpgPPbWR6fCln&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bhphotovideo.com%2Fc%2Fproduct%2F1868814-REG%2Fsandisk_sdsqxfn_256g_gn4nn_256gb_microsd_express_memory.html).

## Best Cyber Monday internal SSD deals

[**SK Hynix Platinum P51 (1TB) PCIe 5.0 SSD for $110 at Newegg ($60 off)**](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=6ce976db-26d7-4094-a1be-4d1496b213f0&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=499da910-4f76-49c5-a36f-e846bcb30f62&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Newegg&linkText=SK+Hynix+Platinum+P51+%281TB%29+PCIe+5.0+SSD+for+%24110+at+Newegg+%28%2460+off%29&&signature=AQAAAb9pEVo5EtE7zGxRK7FKBeZzLwjlVG3AmlEMHBjq-1r_&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.newegg.com%2Fsk-hynix-1tb-nvme%2Fp%2FN82E16820329025): Most people don’t have to pay extra for the top-tier performance of a PCIe 5.0 SSD like the Platinum P51, but if you need something for more intense workloads or just want the comfort of owning a more futureproof SSD, [reviews](https://www.storagereview.com/review/sk-hynix-platinum-p51-review-balanced-performance-for-demanding-workloads) [around](https://www.techpowerup.com/review/sk-hynix-p51-platinum-2-tb/) [the web](https://www.pcmag.com/reviews/sk-hynix-platinum-p51) suggest this is one of the better options available. Just make sure you have a compatible motherboard and CPU first. This offer ties the lowest price yet for the 1TB model. Use the code **BFEFE96** to get the full discount at checkout.

[**Crucial T705 (2TB) PCIe 5.0 SSD with heatsink for $170 at B&H ($150 off)**](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=95276f3c-7b79-4c1e-803f-981cd9f7a968&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=499da910-4f76-49c5-a36f-e846bcb30f62&featureId=text-link&merchantName=B%26H+Photo&linkText=Crucial+T705+%282TB%29+PCIe+5.0+SSD+with+heatsink+for+%24170+at+B%26H+%28%24150+off%29&&signature=AQAAAZ-lJZ5W15DQ2AQmbg_ZHHmtVg4cxdYGcIeYwb92x2ft&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bhphotovideo.com%2Fc%2Fproduct%2F1810944-REG%2Fcrucial_ct2000t705ssd5_2tb_t705_nvme_pcie.html): If you need a bit more room from a PCIe 5.0 drive, the Crucial T705 is a slightly older but [still](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=c813ae39-7d58-41cb-ac66-ad830606ceef&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=499da910-4f76-49c5-a36f-e846bcb30f62&featureId=text-link&merchantName=The+New+York+Times&linkText=still&&signature=AQAAActPGFqOxt-qydRA3Xej3EeNifj--2aylb5pIeKjIGb1&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes.com%2Fwirecutter%2Freviews%2Fbest-ssds%2F) [highly](https://www.tomshardware.com/pc-components/ssds/crucial-t705-2tb-ssd-review) [rated](https://www.pcmag.com/reviews/crucial-t705) alternative with blazing-fast speeds. This is the best price we've tracked for the 2TB model with a heatsink, which isn't 100 percent essential for everyone but helps minimize thermal throttling all the same.

[**Samsung SSD 9100 Pro (8TB) PCIe 5.0 SSD with heatsink for $750 at B&H ($270 off)**](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=95276f3c-7b79-4c1e-803f-981cd9f7a968&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=499da910-4f76-49c5-a36f-e846bcb30f62&featureId=text-link&merchantName=B%26H+Photo&linkText=Samsung+SSD+9100+Pro+%288TB%29+PCIe+5.0+SSD+with+heatsink+for+%24750+at+B%26H+%28%24270+off%29&&signature=AQAAAfHfRR-oUDvRK8NGvuAvWbFB9Tg7r6S0VpGznW5o59XW&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bhphotovideo.com%2Fc%2Fproduct%2F1878205-REG%2Fsamsung_mz_vap8t0cw_8tb_9100_pro_pcie.html): Yes, we realize this is a ton to spend on a new SSD, but if you’re in the niche that wants a PCIe 5.0 drive with as much capacity as possible, it ties the lowest price we’ve tracked for the 8TB variant of Samsung’s top-end model. Most [reviews](https://www.techpowerup.com/review/wd-black-sn8100-2-tb/) [say](https://www.tomshardware.com/pc-components/ssds/sandisk-wd-black-sn8100-2tb-ssd-review) [that](https://www.pcgamesn.com/wd/black-sn8100-review) the 9100 Pro is outpaced by the [WD Black SN8100](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=499da910-4f76-49c5-a36f-e846bcb30f62&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=WD+Black+SN8100&&signature=AQAAAYFl6FOBRPl0gLAZTC3rgaHUX0Zvo6SzsQosSZr0SwBy&gcReferrer=http%3A%2F%2Famazon.com%2FWD_BLACK-SN8100-Internal-Solid-State%2Fdp%2FB0F3BMBQ75) at the enthusiast end of the market, but it’s still competitive, and the [8TB version](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=f45797c5-bae4-4ba9-9419-9454e07b099d&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=499da910-4f76-49c5-a36f-e846bcb30f62&featureId=text-link&merchantName=SanDisk&linkText=8TB+version&&signature=AQAAAeP5BM_4XLfByRuuRZygjrZjIbNaJtnwvplVFKev8k7s&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fshop.sandisk.com%2Fproducts%2Fssd%2Finternal-ssd%2Fwd-black-sn8100-ssd%3Fsku%3DWDS800T1X0M-00CMT0) of that WD drive is priced $250 higher as of this writing. Most other direct rivals, meanwhile, aren’t yet available with this much space.

[**Crucial P310 (2TB) M.2 2230 SSD for $130 at B&H ($111 off, in and out of stock)**](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=95276f3c-7b79-4c1e-803f-981cd9f7a968&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=499da910-4f76-49c5-a36f-e846bcb30f62&featureId=text-link&merchantName=B%26H+Photo&linkText=Crucial+P310+%282TB%29+M.2+2230+SSD+for+%24130+at+B%26H+%28%24111+off%2C+in+and+out+of+stock%29&&signature=AQAAATG7zLe8SEVbtAkdv3XgtSxSFQEWWt7h2qRn1_hIyCuW&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bhphotovideo.com%2Fc%2Fproduct%2F1835939-REG%2Fcrucial_ct2000p310ssd2_p310_2tb_pcie_gen4.html): The P310 is a small-size SSD you can slot in certain thin and light notebooks or gaming handhelds like the [Steam Deck](https://www.engadget.com/steam-deck-oled-review-its-just-better-180038030.html). It uses cheaper QLC memory, not the faster and more durable TLC, but [most](https://www.tweaktown.com/reviews/10790/crucial-p310-2tb-handheld-gaming-ssd-when-qlc-beats-tlc/index.html) [reviews](https://www.tomshardware.com/pc-components/ssds/crucial-p310-ssd-review) [say](https://www.pcworld.com/article/2379686/crucial-p310-nvme-ssd-review.html) it performs well for what it is. This discount is a few bucks above the largest drop to date for the 2TB model, but it’s still about $20 off the drive’s usual street price. Also at [Amazon](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0D61SDZD2&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=499da910-4f76-49c5-a36f-e846bcb30f62&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=Amazon&&signature=AQAAASGh_AvXMPEUoIXsQW79lCwY87rOByc7OizMqA8PLdq1&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fdp%2FB0D61SDZD2%2F).

## Best Cyber Monday portable SSD deals

[**Crucial X10 Pro (4TB) portable SSD for $210 at B&H ($60 off)**](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=95276f3c-7b79-4c1e-803f-981cd9f7a968&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=499da910-4f76-49c5-a36f-e846bcb30f62&featureId=text-link&merchantName=B%26H+Photo&linkText=Crucial+X10+Pro+%284TB%29+portable+SSD+for+%24210+at+B%26H+%28%2460+off%29&&signature=AQAAAQH3NdnRMJL_9XsX2vhulFS-dX9Yz3eqhwKnHn0CW_WD&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bhphotovideo.com%2Fc%2Fproduct%2F1776927-REG%2Fcrucial_ct4000x10prossd9_4tb_x10_pro_usb.html): The X10 Pro is a older and slightly slower version of the X10 — confusing, we know — but it comes with a metal enclosure, a five-year warranty (instead of three) and 256-bit hardware encryption. The X9 Pro and standard X10 are better values when they’re cheaper, but that’s not the case right now if you want a 4TB drive. This deal matches an all-time low.

[**Seagate Storage Expansion Card for Xbox (2TB) for $185 at Amazon ($75 off)**](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B09BJYXMDW&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=499da910-4f76-49c5-a36f-e846bcb30f62&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=Seagate+Storage+Expansion+Card+for+Xbox+%282TB%29+for+%24185+at+Amazon+%28%2475+off%29&custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2dwL3Byb2R1Y3QvQjA5QkpZWE1EVy9yZWY9b3hfc2NfYWN0X3RpdGxlXzE_&signature=AQAAAS5dyBVzhl2QqqRM6bhOmphtEsSZpXsvD0xcGqHVBNID&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fgp%2Fproduct%2FB09BJYXMDW%2Fref%3Dox_sc_act_title_1): Annoying as it is, the only way to [fully add storage](https://support.xbox.com/en-US/help/hardware-network/storage/manage-storage) to an Xbox Series X or Series S is to use a proprietary expansion card. Only two of those exist, and they’re both expensive compared to traditional SSDs. Still, they’re dead simple to set up, and this Seagate model holds up well compared to the consoles’ internal storage. This is a new low for the 2TB model and $15 cheaper than the price we saw on Black Friday. Also at [Best Buy](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=5e0bed65-d2f8-4b34-9b8f-955218c0e37a&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=499da910-4f76-49c5-a36f-e846bcb30f62&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Best+Buy&linkText=Best+Buy&&signature=AQAAAdWne_WhGx8Z0icL1baI2exSlzZ-ItSSe15VR_XMPP3X&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bestbuy.com%2Fproduct%2Fseagate-2tb-storage-expansion-card-for-xbox-series-xs-nvme-ssd-black%2FJ37C5H459S%2Fsku%2F6477864) and [Walmart](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=3719d8d4-5edd-4817-998a-91f3229e7323&itemId=walmart_transaction_590067737&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=499da910-4f76-49c5-a36f-e846bcb30f62&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Walmart&linkText=Walmart&&signature=AQAAAR7pO3lAUO3UdYwMs5xeeHFTWdYgirqvsXknNWStruRN&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.walmart.com%2Fip%2FSeagate-Storage-Expansion-Card-2TB-Solid-State-Drive-NVMe-SSD-for-Xbox-Series-X-S-Quick-Resume-Plug-Play-Licensed-STJR2000400%2F590067737) for $200.

The [4TB variant](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0CNXZS9C5&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=499da910-4f76-49c5-a36f-e846bcb30f62&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=4TB+variant&custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2RwL0IwQ05YWlM5QzU_dGFnPWdkZ3QwYy0yMCIsImNvbnRlbnRVdWlkIjoiNDk5ZGE5MTAtNGY3Ni00OWM1LWEzNmYtZTg0NmJjYjMwZjYyIiwib3JpZ2luYWxVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2RwL0IwQ05YWlM5QzUiLCJkeW5hbWljQ2VudHJhbFRyYWNraW5nSWQiOnRydWUsInNpdGVJZCI6InVzLWVuZ2FkZ2V0IiwicGFnZUlkIjoiMXAtYXV0b2xpbmsiLCJmZWF0dXJlSWQiOiJ0ZXh0LWxpbmsifQ&signature=AQAAAZoGsliUvTzYatxxkERh9SUQ84vL-wJqwspZZHe2caFs&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fdp%2FB0CNXZS9C5) is also discounted at $380 — that’s a ton to spend on one of these things, but it does match the lowest price we’ve tracked for that particular model.
